documents.title: music bringing new manchester artists to sxsw
text: two mancunian acts will join a bbc showcase of new british talent at the renowned south by southwest festival in austin , texas later this year .
indie quartet pale waves and rapper bugzy malone will appear at special shows hosted by the british music embassy .
they follow in the footsteps of rag 'n ' bone man and royal blood , who got early us exposure at the festival .
commonly called sxsw , south by southwest is the one of the world 's most important showcases for new music .
the 10-day event , which runs from 9 to 18 march , attracts artists , talent scouts and record labels from around the world .
author: BBC Entertainment and Arts

documents.title: memorial for woman murdered 30 years ago
text: a bridge will be lit up and service held in memory of a woman who was murdered 30 years ago .
helen mccourt , 22 , vanished near her home in billinge , near st helens , on 9 february 1988 .
her remains have never been found .
former pub landlord ian sims was convicted of murder after blood and an earring was found in the boot of his car but has never revealed where her body is .
helen 's mother marie said sims took the `` heart '' of her family when he murdered her .
`` my life stopped .
i went out searching for helen and that is the main thing i 've been doing for all these years , '' she said .
the steve prescott bridge is being lit up at 19:30 as a service takes place at st mary 's church rc church in billinge .

documents.title: cocaine danger warning after two men collapse
text: two men have collapsed after taking cocaine in blackburn , prompting a police warning for drug users to be vigilant .
paramedics were called to a house in accrington road where a man became seriously ill in the early hours and another man , who had shared the drugs , was found collapsed in a nearby street .
both were taken to royal blackburn hospital and treated in an intensive care unit before beginning to recover .
det sgt iain czapowski said : we are currently investigating the source of this cocaine and are trying to establish why these men suffered such a severe adverse reaction to it .
initially we feared their reaction could prove fatal .
we would advise anyone to avoid taking illegal drugs , however if you have taken cocaine and start to feel unwell please seek medical help immediately . ''

documents.title: man jailed for attempted rape of woman , 18
text: a man who tried to rape an 18-year-old women he had dragged into a tyre garage has been jailed .
paul gibson , 26 , dragged the woman on to the forecourt of the site in dickson road , blackpool , in the early hours of 20 august 2017 .
she fought back before gibson punched her but he was stopped and then held by two men and a woman who saw the attack ,
at preston crown court yesterday , gibson , of dinmore avenue , blackpool , was found guilty of attempted rape and was jailed for six years and placed on the sex offenders register for life .

documents.title: syria war : last of british is 'beatles ' gang captured by kurds
text: two british men believed to be members of a notorious islamic state group ( is ) cell have been seized by syrian kurdish fighters , us officials say .
alexanda kotey , 34 , and el shafee elsheikh , 29 , were the last two members of the cell to remain at large .
the four , all from london , were nicknamed `` the beatles '' because of their british accents .
us officials said the `` execution cell '' had beheaded at least 27 western hostages - including salford aid worker alan henning - and tortured many more .

text: police have revealed a woman found dead in rochdale yesterday had been stabbed several times .
the 47-year-old woman , who has not been named , was found with multiple stab wounds at a property in clement royds street , greater manchester police said .
a 31-year-old man was arrested on sus of murder earlier .

documents.title: fire crews scaled back at rochdale fire
text: efforts to douse a large fire at an industrial unit in rochdale have been scaled back after more than 14 hours .
greater manchester fire and rescue service have now reduced their crews to four engines and two aerial units .
at the fire 's peak there were 100 firefighters and 10,000 litres of water being used every to tackle the blaze every minute .
it led to the closure of several schools in the town and some train delays .

documents.title: updated : funeral for football legend jimmy armfield
text: here 's our full story following the funeral of former england captain and blackpool fc star jimmy armfield has taken place .
armfield , who died last month aged 82 , was capped 43 times by england , 15 as captain and made a club record 627 appearances for blackpool .
he later managed bolton wanderers and leeds united , and was a bbc radio commentator for more than 35 years .
hundreds of fans applauded the funeral cortege as it passed through bloomfield road stadium before the church service .

documents.title: football : the rise of liverpool and egypt 's modest , hard-working superstar
text: mohamed salah had already placed himself in liverpool 's record books before a driving , darting run and angled finish for his second goal in sunday 's thrilling 2-2 draw with tottenham at anfield was likened to a lionel messi moment .
when manager jurgen klopp 's £ 34.3m summer signing from roma scored his first , he became the fastest liverpool player to reach 20 premier league goals .
he achieved it in 25 games , two games quicker than fernando torres and daniel sturridge .

documents.title: jimmy armfield was 'football royalty '
text: they came to honour a man lauded as footballing royalty - but also a `` gentleman '' who had the common touch .
crowds of mourners arrived in blackpool to say a final goodbye to much-loved jimmy armfield .
a steady stream of people filed into bloomfield road to honour the former england and tangerines legend , who later became a respected bbc broadcaster , as well as working for the fa .
but while armfield 's footballing achievements were high in people 's minds , many also came to pay tribute to the man who became a tireless worker for local charities .
rich or poor , old or young - many of the mourners braved spiteful seaside to offer the same sentiment : `` he never spoke about himself .
he was always interested in you and your welfare . ''

a tide of tangerine tributes swamped his statue outside the ground , but blackpool 's signature colours were interspersed with tributes from other clubs from around the land , from rangers to limerick , and blackburn to leeds .
author: Paul Burnell
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: the 'draw of blackpool ' for armfield
text: jimmy armfield 's sons have talked of their father 's affinity with blackpool at his funeral service .
armfield was originally from denton , greater manchester , but moved to the seaside resort and became known as mr blackpool .
his sons john and duncan told st peter 's church he talked about the `` draw of blackpool being too great '' and that is why he never left the resort .

documents.title: 'why was n't the chief executive fired ? 'acute and community health statement
text: labour 's rosie cooper first raised concerns about the trust in 2014 and has been instrumental in bringing its problems to light .
she says `` the higher echelons of the nhs closed ranks to protect themselves '' and were able to find jobs within the nhs for senior figures at lch .
she asks : `` why was n't the chief executive and board fired ? ''
and adds that it is `` incomprehensible '' that they were n't .

stephen barclay tells her that nhs england has been `` asked to clarify '' how those nhs managers were found new jobs but says there 's `` a recognition this [ practice ] has changed significantly '' .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: vicar pays tribute to 'wonderful ' jimmy as service gets under way
text: at the start of the service , vicar tracy charnock said : `` the church was a huge part of jimmy 's life .
`` he loved his faith as much as he loved football .
jimmy was wonderful in his connection with people across communities - blackpool , the country and the world . ''

documents.title: warnings over consequences of cuts for patientsacute and community health statement
text: shadow health minister justin madders expresses `` huge concern '' that the failures at lch went unchecked after the francis report and the introduction of a `` duty of candour '' for nhs staff .
he asks , in light of dr bill kirkup 's findings , how the government will ensure that nhs trusts are `` no longer being allowed to prioritise financial savings over patient care '' .
this point is echoed by the conservative chair of the health committee , sarah wollaston , who says cost-cutting has `` disastrous consequences '' for patients .

minister stephen barclay says the methodology used to alert regulators to areas of concern has been revised but it `` remains to be explained '' how poor care could continue after several disciplinary measures .
he acknowledges that a culture of cost-cutting led to failings , adding : `` it 's a culture we need to put an end to . ''
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: minister apologises to liverpool community health patientsacute and community health statement
text: health minister stephen barclay is making a statement on acute and community health , following a review of liverpool community health trust carried out by dr bill kirkup .
the report found that patients trust suffered `` unnecessary harm '' because a senior leadership team was `` out of its depth '' .
it also concluded that cost-cutting led to severe staff shortages and bullying .
mr barclay apologises to patients on behalf of the government for the `` poor care and lack of insight '' and says their families have been `` vindicated '' in their fight for justice .
he says the government accepts the report 's recommendations in full .
author: House of Commons
Parliament

documents.title: 'inadvertent manoeuvre ' in fatal plane crash
text: a light aircraft which crashed , killing two cheshire men , was unable to recover from an `` inadvertent manoeuvre '' , an investigation has found .
nick jefferies and scott penlington , from holmes chapel , died at the scene at cwmbach , builth wells , in september 2016 .
witnesses noted the plane 's wing had folded back on itself before it corkscrewed and hit the ground .
theair accidents investigation branch reportsaid the impact `` was not survivable '' .

documents.title: appeal to trace missing mother who took her children from care
text: police are appealing for information to trace a mother who has taken her two children from local authority care .
rayan azzydi , 36 , who was living in north west london , was last seen on 2 november .
it is believed she is with her two children , a seven-year-old boy and a six-year-old girl .
ms azzydi has links to manchester , liverpool and birmingham .
officers are working with partners from the relevant local authority to try and locate ms azzydi and her children - the welfare of all three remains the priority in this investigation .

documents.title: funeral for football legend jimmy armfield
text: the funeral of former england football captain jimmy armfield will take place later , with a church service and a gathering of mourners at blackpool fc 's bloomfield road stadium .
armfield , who died last month aged 82 , was capped 43 times by england , 15 of them as captain , and made a club record 627 appearances for blackpool .
he later managed bolton wanderers and leeds united , and was a bbc radio commentator for more than 35 years .
the funeral cortege will leave bloomfield road before a private service at st peter 's church from 12:30 gmt .
there will be an audio link from the church to the stadium , so fans can listen to the service .
we 'll bring you more on this later .
author: Paul Burnell
BBC News

documents.title: fifth murder arrest over brandon regan death
text: a fifth man been arrested over the death of a teenager whose body was found in a garden in liverpool .
the body of brandon regan , 17 , was found on 29 january in speke .
a 21-year-old man from widnes was arrested on sus of murder and a vehicle suspected of being used in the killing has also been recovered , merseyside police said .
four men , aged 23 , 24 , 31 and 32 , held on sus of murder have been released on conditional bail .

documents.title: snow and ice warning continues
text: more cold and icy weather could cause disruption to commuters in the north of the region , the met office is warning .
heavy snow showers are expected to follow on from a spell of rain , sleet and hill snow late on thursday , mainly affecting staffordshire and cheshire , forecasters said .

documents.title: rochdale fire : homes evacuated after industrial unit blaze
text: about 100 firefighters have spent the night tackling a blaze at an industrial unit in greater manchester .
crews were called to albert royds street in rochdale at about 01:20 gmt , greater manchester fire and rescue service said .
a number of homes nearby have been evacuated and people living near the scene are advised to keep their doors and windows closed due to smoke .
the fire is expected to cause travel disruption throughout the morning .

documents.title: chief constable 'bullied staff '
text: a chief constable is facing a disciplinary hearing accused of `` angry outbursts and aggressive attacks '' on his staff , along with bullying claims .
details of the gross misconduct allegations against simon byrne have been released by cheshire police and crime commissioner 's office .
mr byrne , who has been chief constable since 2014 , was suspended in august pending the hearing .
neither mr byrne nor the force has commented on the case .

documents.title: 'unplanned move ' caused fatal plane crash
text: a light aircraft which crashed and killed two men from cheshire was unable to recover from an `` inadvertent manoeuvre '' , an investigation has found .
nick jefferies and scott penlington died at the scene at cwmbach , builth wells , in september 2016 .
witnesses noted the plane 's wing had folded back on itself before it corkscrewed and hit the ground .
the air accidents investigation branch report said the impact `` was not survivable '' .

documents.title: tyson & hughie fury : ukad spent £ 577,000 on legal fees
text: uk anti-doping spent almost £ 600,000 on legal fees in the case involving former heavyweight world champion tyson fury and cousin hughie .
last year tyson fury , 29 , accepted a backdated two-year ban from ukad , ending a lengthy legal battle .
he tested positive for banned steroid nandrolone in february 2015 , but blamed it on eating uncastrated wild boar .
ukad , which has an annual budget of about £ 8m , said it spent £ 577,717 on legal fees .
the money was paid to solicitors for `` advice '' and representation when fury and hughie , who also tested positive , appeared before an anti-doping panel tribunal .
author: BBC Sport

text: shots have been fired in kirkby but there have been no reports of any injuries , police have confirmed.police said a convenience store in james holt avenue was damaged in the shooting that was reported at about 14:50 .

documents.title: failed nhs trust caused 'unnecessary harm '
text: patients at a failed nhs trust suffered `` unnecessary harm '' because a senior leadership team was `` out of its depth '' , says a report seen by bbc news .
misguided cost-cutting at liverpool community health ( lch ) led to severe staff shortages and bullying , it found .
despite the problems , bbc news has also seen evidence that regulators helped the trust 's chief executive find another six-figure nhs job .
lch said it would respond to the report once it was published on thursday .

text: iconic steam engine the flying scotsman is to visit the north west as part of a uk tour this summer .
the tour will kick off with the engine on public display at the east lancashire railway on 10 and 11 march .
there will also be trips available on the engine on the heritage railway line , which runs from rawtenstall in lancashire to heywood in greater manchester .

last year , timetables were withdrawn by one operator on its website after a problem with fans trespassing on the line and officials are asking people not to put themselves in danger ahead of the 2018 tour .

documents.title: leonardo da vinci drawings to go on show
text: twelve drawings by leonardo da vinci from the royal collection are to go on show at birmingham museum and art gallery .
it 's part of simultaneous exhibitions around the uk to mark the 500th anniversary of the renaissance master 's death .

museum manager , gurminder kenth , said : `` when a selection of leonardo drawings were on display here at the museum in 2012 , it was an extremely popular exhibition , with queues forming for the chance to see the works up close .
almost 150 drawings will go on show next february in belfast , birmingham , bristol , cardiff , glasgow , leeds , liverpool , manchester , sheffield , southampton and sunderland ,
the will then be brought together in may for an exhibition at the queen 's gallery , buckingham palace , in what is billed as the `` largest exhibition of leonardo 's work in over 65 years '' .

documents.title: five-month old baby gorilla takes first steps
text: a five-month old baby western lowland gorilla has taken its first steps at blackpool zoo .
makari , whose species is endangered , was born on 5 september last year .
he is the third baby for father bukavu and the second for mother miliki .
the zoo 's acting section head of primates simon childs said :
we have recently seen him wobbling cautiously over to his father to play with the hair on his arms , which bukavu does n't seem to mind .
it 's so wonderful to see the family all together - they are such a content group , which is testament to the great job all the keepers here do .

documents.title: plans to renovate salford apartment block
text: plans to renovate an apartment block in salford have been announced .
the eight-storey building on canon green drive has distinctive blue balconies and has provided the backdrop for several television dramas , including channel 4 's no offence and itv 's prey .
housing association salix homes has been working with residents to develop proposals to modernise the 1960s building .
as well as plans to revamp the appearance , the proposals include the development of an additional 100-unit apartment block .
work could begin on site later this year , and completed in 2020 .

documents.title: ariana grande felt 'every name ' of the manchester bombing victims
text: ariana grande cried for days after the manchester arena attack and felt `` every name '' of the victims who died in the bombing , her manager has said .
scooter braun said he and the singer met 19 families who had lost loved ones , which was the `` hardest two hours of either of our lives '' .
ariana suffered from trauma after the attack and questioned whether she could sing her songs ever again , he added .
but she decided to do a tribute concert so the victims did n't `` die in vain '' .
`` the terrorist made a mistake they the wrong god damn show , '' scooter said of the bombing on 22 may - in which 22 people died .
`` because if they thought we were going to roll over they do n't know ariana and they do n't know me . ''

dick follows recalls hearing about what happened on the radio when he went for a haircut aged 10 .

documents.title: city galleries to show da vinci drawings
text: galleries in liverpool and manchester will help mark the 500th anniversary of leonardo da vinci 's death as part of a programme of exhibitions across the uk .

the walker art gallery in liverpool and the manchester art gallery will each display one of the twelve drawings , alongside galleries in belfast , birmingham , bristol , cardiff , glasgow , leeds , sheffield , southampton and sunderland .
his sketch , the head of leda , created in about 1508 , will be on display in liverpool , while manchester will show 1510 's the head of a youth .
the exhibitions will open in february 2019 .

text: denise fergus , the mother of james bulger , faced a `` horrendous ordeal '' as she listened to the `` vile behaviour '' of her son 's killer jon venables being outlined in court , her spokesman has said .
venables , who along with robert thompson , murdered james in 1993 , has admitted having over 1,000 indecent images of children and a child abuse manual and been jailed for 40 months .
speaking after the hearing , chris johnson of the justice for james campaign said :
the length of the sentence is too short .
three years is really a farce because this is reoffending and there is a pattern to this behaviour .
there should be no further collusion or attempts to cover up his offending behaviour .
if re-bailed , he must be kept on a very tight leash .

the response officer was arrested in april 2017 and immediately suspended .
ali , of bacup , lancashire , was sentenced at preston crown court on tuesday after being convicted of four counts of misconduct in public office .

police said a man distracted the sales assistant , and while she had her back turned , took the watch from its display and walked out of the shop .
staff only realised it was missing later that evening when checking stock .

documents.title: judge calls venables manipulative and dishonest
text: the judge has told jon venables , who has been jailed for 40 months for making over 1,000 indecent images of children and having a child abuse manual , that he is a `` manipulative and dishonest '' man .

mr justice edis told venables that his case was `` unique '' because of his part in the murder of toddler james bulger in 1993 , a killing which had `` revolted the nation '' and `` continues to do so , even after the 25 years that has passed since it happened '' .
he said the images he downloaded would be `` heartbreaking for any ordinary person to see '' and his offences `` went back some months and required some ingenuity to keep it hidden '' .
making venables the subject of an indefinite sexual harm prevention order , the judge said the parole board would decide when he would be released .

documents.title: laura kenny to return at track cycling world championships
text: four-time olympic champion laura kenny will make her competitive return at the track cycling world championships .
the 25-year-old , who has not competed since 2016 , will be joined by husband and six-time olympic gold medallist jason kenny in the british squad .

i returned to training about four months ago , and i 've been really pleased and i guess a bit shocked by how fast my form has started to come back .

the championships start on 28 february in apeldoorn , netherlands .

documents.title: women 's vote : calls for suffragettes to be pardoned
text: women who were jailed while fighting for the right to vote should be pardoned , say campaigners .
scottish conservative leader ruth davidson has joined with the fawcett society campaign group and relatives of the suffragettes in calling for convictions to be overturned .
it comes on the 100th anniversary of the first women to be given the vote in the uk .
theresa may will mark the centenary with a speech in manchester hailing the `` heroism '' of the suffragettes .

documents.title: memorial service held in munich on disaster anniversary
text: a second memorial ceremony has also been held in germany at the monument marking the 60th anniversary of the disaster in munich .

manchester united ambassador denis irwin and senior executives joined around 2,000 fans to remember the 23 people who died including eight players , three club staff , eight journalists , two crew members and two passengers .

a few surviving doctors and nurses involved in the treatment of manager sir matt busby and his team were in attendance , with the fans donating art to the hospital in an expression of gratitude for the treatment they provided .
the mayor of munich and senior figures from the city 's bundesliga side bayern muenchen including uli hoeness and karl-heinz rummenigge were also in attendance .

documents.title: from the scene : snow falls during 'poignant ' old trafford service
text: around 4,500 people were present for this afternoon 's 40-minute service , which poigniantly took place amid a light snow fall .
the presence of the two remaining survivors , harry gregg and sir bobby charlton was particularly well received .
charlton , as a director , arrived with the main manchester united party .

gregg , who said it will be the last time he comes to old trafford , came slightly later and sat behind current first team manager jose mourinho , who made a point of shaking the hand of the northern irishman , who went to the club 's carrington training complex earlier on tuesday to meet the players .

club officials wore ties bearing the names of the eight players who died in the tragedy , skipper roger byrne the first one read out by the united chaplain john boyers in a roll call of the 23 who lost their lives in munich following a refuelling stop on the way back from belgrade .
sheffield wednesday , united 's first opponents after the crash , were represented , as were bishop auckland , who loaned the club players .

in addition , kenny dalglish was present , and was former manchester city star mike summerbee , in a nod to the loss felt by the whole city given former blues keeper frank swift was one of the journalists who died .
author: Simon Stone
BBC Sport at Old Trafford

`` i think it 's bound to be ( my last time at old trafford ) .
it has to be , '' 85-year-old gregg told bbc sport ni .
gregg continues to play down the hero 's label he received after helping to pull survivors from the wreckage .

documents.title: hundred years since women were given vote
text: events are being held across the north west today to mark 100 years since the first women in the country were given the right to vote .
the representation of the people act gave women over the age of 30 the right to vote .
as well as having to be over a certain age , it was also restricted to those women who were married or owned a home .
full equality followed a decade later .
prime minister theresa may is expected to hail `` the heroism '' of the suffragettes in a speech in manchester later as part of the celebrations .

text: macclesfield town majority shareholder amar alkadhi says a technical issue with his bank caused a late payment to players and staff .
the national league club issued an apology on friday after january 's salaries were not paid on time .
the club saidthe delay was caused by a late payment from a third party .
`` i would like to offer an unreserved apology to players , fans , and the chairman for the delay in paying wages , '' alkadhi said in a statement .

text: people are being advised to take care when out and about following a yellow warning of snow and ice for the region .
the met office have issued the warning for today and tomorrow , with parts of the region expected to see some snow and sleet showers .
there is likely to be some disruption on the roads and possible delays on public transport .
more information can be found here .

documents.title: man found fatally stabbed in back garden was 'best brother you could ask for '
text: the family of a man who was found with fatal stab wounds in a back garden have paid tribute to him .
the body of robert john sempey , 37 , was found in beilby road , haydock , on 21 january .
a post-mortem examination established he died as a result of stab wounds .
his partner , lisa , said he was the `` most caring , loving man you could ever wish for '' , while his sister shell said he had been `` the best brother you could ask for '' .
ian robertson , 33 , of beilby road , has been charged with mr sempey 's murder and kirsty jervis , 30 , also of beilby road , has been charged with assisting an offender .
both are due to appear for trial at liverpool crown court on 16 july .

in a statement posted on twitter , the pop star apologised to fans and said she was `` devastated '' , but needed to put `` myself and my well-being '' first .
the grammy award-winning singer has fibromyalgia , a long-term condition which can cause pain all over the body .
ticket holders can apply for a refund from 6 february , the statement added .

documents.title: oldham chronicle makes online comeback
text: oldham 's local newspaper which was closed in august , after 163 years in print , is to return as an online publication .
new owners credible media ltd have announced that the oldham chronicle will return online on 14 february .
the paper folded on 31 august after its parent company , hirst , kidd and rennie ltd , went into administration .

credible media , which owns local radio station revolution 96.2 , purchased the chronicle in october , along with the rights to its quarterly magazines oldham business edge , the knowledge and lifestyle publication , signature .

documents.title: girl who came to abuse victim 's rescue honoured
text: a girl who came to the aid of a victim of domestic violence has been honoured by cheshire police .
demi o'sullivan , 13 , from ellesmere port , spotted the distressed woman , who had a cut to her head , as she walked home from the park and went to comfort her .
she was told the woman 's partner threw a mug at her and made her leave her house .
describing what happened , demi said :
i called the police and ambulance on her phone and took her around the corner , away from the house .
i then ran home to get a cloth , my mum was in and she came with me to help .
demi 's mum , berni , said she was `` made up '' with what her daughter did .
pc steph allison , who was the first officer on the scene , said it was `` amazing how brave she was '' .

acting chief constable janette mccormick gave demi and her mum a tour of cheshire police headquarters in winsford , which included meeting one of the force 's sniffer dogs , sidney , and presented her with a £ 40 gift card and certificate of appreciation from the force .

documents.title: ex-players and others guilty of football fraud
text: a former manchester city player , a merseyside businessman and two other men have been found guilty of fraud charges after taking £ 5m in a fake apprenticeship scheme .
former striker paul sugrue , 56 , of cardiff , and jack harper , 30 , of merseyside , invented false players to claim the money .
ex-wales defender mark aizlewood , 57 , of aberdare , and fellow director keith williams , 45 , from anglesey , also took part in the scam .
two men - christopher martin , 53 , of catmore , berkshire , and stephen gooding , 53 , from bridgwater , somerset - previously admitted their part in the youth training scheme fraud .
judge michael tomlinson described the case as `` very serious '' at southwark crown court and adjourned sentencing until 26 february , releasing all the men on bail .

documents.title: police investigating resort death seek seven witnesses
text: detectives investigating the death of a man in blackpool last month believe seven potential witnesses could have been in the area at the time .
george crawley , 63 was found with head injuries at a property in clinton avenue , blackpool , at about 02:15 gmt on 15 january and was pronounced dead at the scene .
lancashire police want to hear from a group of five men heard behind the property at about 22:50 gmt on 14 january .
officers also want to trace two hooded people seen running down the avenue about 45 minutes before mr crawley was found dead .
a 63-year-old man has been charged with murder .

documents.title: man bought 200 bottles of water to help leak-hit hospitals
text: a man whose grandmother was caught up in the problems at four of manchester 's hospitals caused by a major water leak made his own effort to ease the crisis - by turning up with 200 bottles of water .

marcus mccluskey , 23 , spent three hours visiting manchester royal infirmary ( mri ) , manchester royal eye hospital and royal manchester children 's hospital on sunday night delivering the bottles .

he had bought them from a garage shop in nearby ardwick green and a small supermarket at manchester piccadilly railway station after realising `` a bad situation '' had been `` made worse by local supermarkets being closed on a sunday '' .

he said his grandmother had been a mri patient since july last year and `` a few hundred bottles of water is nothing to ensure that the hard-working staff and most seriously ill patients have access to water '' .
the water supply has now been restored , the manchester university nhs foundation trust said .

the crash , which caused damage to the window of a shop , happened at about 11:30 on ranelagh street .
a man was treated at the scene for injuries , which are not thought to be life threatening .
anyone with any information is asked to contact police .

the hospitals affected were the royal infirmary , the royal eye hospital , saint mary 's hospital and royal manchester children 's hospital .
operations on monday morning were cancelled after a major leak on sunday .
manchester university nhs foundation trust said the water supply has been restored and scheduled operations for monday afternoon will take place .

the 30-year-old had been in albert 's restaurant in swinton with a friend before they left and headed towards the car park .
they were approached by another man , who then shot the victim in the knee .
the offender , who was dressed in dark clothing , left the scene in a silver ford focus .

text: three men , including one from blackpool , have been arrested and seven dogs seized by police cracking down on hare coursing in lincolnshire .
farmers joined forces with rural crime officers on saturday after police were tipped off about suspected hare coursers in fields in ealand , near scunthorpe .
officers saw about six men with dogs in a field who ran off .
they are due in court later .

documents.title: kim cattrall announces brother 's death
text: sex and the city actress kim cattrall has announced the death of her brother , after earlier issuing a public appeal for information on his whereabouts .
christopher cattrall , 55 , had been missing from his home in alberta , canada , since tuesday .
liverpool-born kim cattrall had appealed to her social media followers for help finding him .
later on sunday , the actress posted a message on twitter saying : `` it is with great sadness that myself and my family announce the unexpected passing of our son and brother , chris cattrall . ''

documents.title: nine men charged over truro jewellery shop robbery
text: nine men have been charged over an armed robbery at michael spiers jewellers in truro last month , police say .
five of the men are charged with robbery , conspiracy to commit robbery and having an imitation firearm with intent to commit an indictable offence after the raid on wednesday 11 january :
three men are charged with conspiracy to commit robbery :
harijus jaciaskas , 32 , from manchester , has been charged with conspiracy to commit robbery and breach of a deportation order .
all nine have been remanded in custody and are due appear before truro crown court on tuesday 13 february .

documents.title: 'man city players relishing time off ' , de bruyne says
text: kevin de bruyne says manchester city 's weary players are grateful for some time off before their next game against leicester .

`` i was feeling it from the first minute , '' said de bruyne after the match at turf moor .
`` i 've said it before - you feel great for 10 games , ok for 10 games , and then the rest you feel rubbish . ''

documents.title: two suffer burns in house explosion
text: two elderly people have suffered burns in a suspected gas explosion in bolton .
several properties were evacuated following the blast in rydal grove in farnworth , greater manchester fire and rescue service said .
a man in his 70s is in a serious condition at wythenshaw hospital and another person is injured .
one witness told the manchester evening news how he and a friend managed to get the pair out of the house , where `` the smell of gas was overpowering '' .

documents.title: angry klopp fumes after kane penalty
text: liverpool manager jurgen klopp claimed he would have to `` pay the biggest fine in world football '' if he vented his true feelings about harry kane 's stoppage-time penalty that earned tottenham a draw at anfield .

kane - who had seen a penalty saved by liverpool goalkeeper loris karius minutes earlier - secured spurs a point in a 2-2 draw after referee jon moss contentiously punished virgil van dijk 's challenge on substitute erik lamela with seconds remaining .

klopp was still visibly angry at what he saw as the unjust loss of two points , with liverpool 's fans also enraged at the final whistle after thinking mohamed salah 's brilliant injury-time solo goal had given them a win that would have taken them five points clear of spurs in the race for a top-four spot .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new train fleet to replace pacers
text: rail operator northern is replacing its 30-year-old pacers with new trains .
the 98-strong fleet will come into service by christmas and are capable of travelling at 100mph ( 160 km/h ) , will be fully accessible , and have wi-fi and plug sockets .
the first completed train is due off the production line in the coming weeks .
northern 's managing director said it was a `` landmark moment '' for rail travel in the north of england .

documents.title: woman raped close to supermarket
text: a woman has been raped close to a supermarket in greater manchester .
the victim , in her 40s , was standing outside the tesco store in chester road , stretford at about 06:30 on sunday when she was approached by a man .
he raped her at a nearby bench , police said .
the man is described as 5ft 6ins ( 1.67m ) tall , asian , of medium build with a short beard and black hair .
he was wearing a black overcoat with dark jeans and a brown belt .

documents.title: three charged over bar attack murder
text: three men have been charged with murdering a 29-year-old who was attacked in a bar in liverpool city centre .
anthony condron , from huyton , was assaulted in the maya bar in wood street at about 01:00 on saturday .
jamie addison , 22 , of bridgewater street , liverpool ; joseph booth , 24 , of ashbourne road , aigburth ; and paul byrne , 23 , of ribbledale road , mossley hill , have been charged with murder .
the men are due to appear at liverpool magistrates ' court later .

documents.title: could skipton-colne railway be reopened ?
text: a study has been commissioned to look into the reopening of a railway line between skipton and colne .
the 12-mile route connecting lancashire with north yorkshire last ran in 1970 and , if reopened , it could lead to new services between lancashire , skipton and leeds .
transport secretary chris grayling said the line could provide a `` vital link across the pennines '' .
`` i want this study to look clearly at the business case and value that the line could provide , '' said mr grayling .
the feasibility study was announced by the transport secretary on a visit to colne railway station .

documents.title: corrie 's antony cotton to skate on despite injury
text: two fractured ribs wo n't stop corrie 's antony cotton performing on dancing on ice this weekend .
cotton , who plays sean tully in itv 's coronation street , was injured on wednesday while training with partner brandee malto .
the 42-year-old was taken to hospital but has since said he hopes to appear on sunday 's programme as scheduled .
`` the show must go on , '' he said in a statement .
`` hopefully the painkillers and sequins will see us through . ''
author: BBC Entertainment and Arts

documents.title: why a statue to an american president is located in manchester
text: there are some sights in cities across england that have left people puzzled , including y include why manchester is the home of a statue of former american president abraham lincoln .
the statue honours manchester 's allegiance to abraham lincoln 's union during the american civil war .
the city boycotted cotton in the southern states in protest against slave labour , according to visit manchester .
the resulting lancashire cotton famine led to mass unemployment and poverty among textile workers in manchester .
they put their principles ahead of the need to feed their families and their actions assisted lincoln in ending the civil war .
lincoln wrote a letter praising the working people of manchester for their `` sublime christian heroism '' .
read more here .

documents.title: owen to play at hometown club chester
text: former england star michael owen is leading a campaign to help his father terry 's old club chester overcome their current financial issues .
the club needs £ 50,000 to survive until the end of the season .
chester-born owen is helping out by playing in a one-off fundraising game at the fan-owned phoenix club 's bumpers lane home on 15 february .
it 's so important that we do what we can to help .
we ca n't lose this club again .

i was born in chester and brought up listening to my dad 's stories about the glory days from his playing time at chester fc , including the run to the semi-final of the league cup as a fourth division club in 1974-75 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: murder accused remanded over darwen bar stabbing
text: a man charged with murder over the fatal stabbing of a 23-year-old at a darwen bar has been remanded in custody .
jay jay livesey taylor was attacked at esco-bar on the green in the early hours of sunday before being found unconscious outside .
he was taken to royal preston hospital but later died .
jack costello , 44 , from rishton , appeared at preston crown court earlier and was remanded until his next appearance there on 26 march .

documents.title: new exhibition remembers 'busby babe ' duncan edwards
text: a new exhibition to remember one of the victims of the munich air disaster has opened in the west midlands .
manchester united and england legend duncan edwards was one of eight players who died as a result of the crash on 6 february 1958 .
the dudley-born player , who was one of the infamous busby babes .
died two weeks later aged 21 .
the exhibition looks at edwards ' younger years in his hometown .

the 14-year-old , who can not be named for legal reasons , struck may laidlaw , 78 , as she crossed queens drive in walton , liverpool , on 2 december .
the teenager previously admitted to causing death by dangerous driving and failing to stop after a road accident .
he was sentenced to three years in a young offenders institute at liverpool crown court .

text: former british heavyweight champion david price says he has a `` massive chance '' when he fights alexander povetkin on the anthony joshua undercard in march .
liverpool-born price , 34 , returned to the ring in december after 10 months out and earned a points win against kamil sokolowski .
he admits it is a `` big ask '' to win the bout but added that `` upsets do happen '' .
russia 's povetkin , 38 , has lost just once in his 34-fight career - against wladimir klitschko in 2013 .

documents.title: city 's £ 10m flood defence completed
text: a £ 10m scheme to protect around 2,000 homes and businesses from flooding in greater manchester , has been completed .
the salford project has created a flood storage basin that can hold enough water to fill more than 250 olym swimming pools , the environment agency said .
it will protect properties in the city which were hit by the boxing day floods in 2015 .
homes were flooded and evacuated in kersal , lower broughton and trinity .

text: a doctor has told liverpool family court that in his opinion a 20-month-old baby can not recover from a degenerative brain condition .
clinicians at alder hey children 's hospital want to end life support for alfie evans from bootle because they say it 's not in his best interests .
alfie 's parents want to take him to a hospital in rome where they believe his condition - that has not been precisely diagnosed - can be treated .
the doctor , who can not be named , disputed the boy 's parents ' claim that alfie can follow his mother 's movements .
in a previous statement , he said alfie is unable to express pain , comfort or pleasure .

documents.title: thornton motorbike rider dies in larbeck three-vehicle crash
text: a motorcyclist has been killed in a three-vehicle crash in lancashire .
the 30-year-old from thornton died after his honda nc 750 collided with a land rover and a truck on the a586 at larbeck , near poulton-le-fylde , at about 17:50 gmt on tuesday .
lancashire police said the road was closed for six hours but has reopened .
a 37-year-old preston man and a 45-year-old man from blackpool have been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving .

documents.title: elderly woman tied up in manchester burglary
text: a 75-year-old woman has been tied up and her home ransacked during a burglary in greater manchester .
the woman was confronted by three men after returning to her home in heaton moor , stockport , on monday afternoon .
the men , who had broken in after smashing patio doors , took jewelry and cash before tying the woman up and locking her in the bathroom .
one of the men drove away in a silver volkswagen jetta while the other two left on foot .
anyone with any information is asked to contact police .
thankfully the victim was n't left with any serious injuries but she has been left extremely shaken and now has to live with the trauma of this attack .

documents.title: man murdered 'for the sake of an xbox '
text: a man who beat up and repeatedly stabbed his victim to death `` for the sake of an xbox and a few dvds '' has been jailed for a minimum of 36 years .
michael pickering , 31 , armed himself with a knife and attacked jonathan herd , 44 , in his oldham flat on 30 july , manchester crown court was told on thursday .
mr heard was found dead by members of his family at the lees new road flat .
pickering was arrested the next day after using mr herd 's mobile phone to order a taxi to a pawnbrokers .

documents.title: sisters appeal against convictions for boyfriend murder
text: two sisters jailed for life for murdering one of their ex-boyfriends in a botched burglary claim they were wrongly convicted .
maureen smith , 44 , and her sister kelly , 41 , planned a raid in which david corridon , 32 , was stabbed to death in norris green , liverpool .
but the convictions were unsafe , argued their lawyers at the court of appeal .
the sisters , from toxteth , liverpool , recruited criminals to steal up to £ 40,000 at mr corridon 's home in new hall lane , norris green , but he was stabbed six times .
they were convicted of murder with three men after a trial at liverpool crown court in january 2013 .

documents.title: oystons 'miss ' £ 10m payment deadline
text: blackpool fc 's owners have failed to meet the deadline for a £ 10m payment to a former club director , his representatives have said .
owen and karl oyston family lost a high court battle with latvian businessman valeri belokon in november .
the pair missed a £ 10m payment due by wednesday under the terms ofa £ 31m court order to buy him out , the bbc understands .
the oystons have been approached for comment .

documents.title: men wanted over grandmother 's murder
text: police investigating the unsolved murder of an 87-year-old woman who was repeatedly beaten during a burglary have released images of two suspects .
eileen blane ( below ) was thrown to the floor and had her wedding ring taken from her finger during the raid in stretford , greater manchester , in february 2017 .
she spent eight weeks in hospital and died the day after she was discharged .
greater manchester police has made a fresh appeal for information on the first anniversary of her death .

documents.title: man murdered 'for the sake of an xbox '
text: a man who repeatedly stabbed a man to death for an `` xbox and dvds '' in oldham has been jailed for life .
armed with a knife michael pickering , 31 , entered 44-year-old jonathan herd 's flat on lees new road and killed him in july .
he then used mr herd 's mobile phone to order himself a taxi to a pawnbrokers which refused to buy the stolen items .
det ch insp stuart wilkinson from gmp said it was a `` horrific attack on an innocent man for the sake of an x box and some dvds '' .

documents.title: planned skyscraper would have 'devastating impact ' on manchester
text: ex-footballers gary neville and ryan giggs 's £ 200m plans to redevelop part of central manchester would have a `` devastating impact on the harmony and splendour '' of the city , a campaign group has said .
after criticism from historic england ( he ) in july , plans to build one of two skyscrapers in the jackson 's row area of the city were scrapped .
on monday , he snubbed the revised plans , stating it still could not back the st michael 's scheme due to the `` cumulative harm '' to nearby listed buildings .
now the save britain 's heritage group have compared the planned skyscraper to paris ' montparnasse tower .
the construction of that tower in the 1970s was hugely controversial and led to ban on buildings over seven stories high in the city centre .
not since the montparnasse tower was built has a single tower proposal been so damaging to a great european townscape .
the revival of manchester 's near dormant historic core into a vibrant city centre full of restored victorian buildings and well-designed modern ones is an outstanding achievement .

it has depended not on flashy iconic buildings but first class local architects who have maintained the muscular grit of the city centre [ and ] manchester planners must not be allowed to destroy their own finest achievement

documents.title: man jailed over sibling sex viral video
text: a man who duped a teenager into performing sex acts on her younger brother on video before sharing it `` for the world to see '' has been jailed .
daniel norton , 26 , who posed as a police officer to trick the girl , `` plumbed the depths of depravity '' , a judge said .
both children were bullied and had to move schools after the footage went viral , southampton crown court heard .
norton , of cheadle , stockport , was jailed for 12 years .

documents.title: man injured 'after falling from third-floor balcony at college '
text: a man is believed to have fallen from a third-floor balcony at manchester city college .
police and paramedics were called to the college in the northern moor area of the city shortly before 16:00 gmt .
both emergency services remain at the scene .
a gmp spokeswoman said inquiries were ongoing .
no arrests have been made , and the injured man 's condition is not yet known .

documents.title: selling hugill was a good thing - neil
text: preston north end boss alex neil says selling jordan hugill to west ham united for £ 10m was a `` good thing '' .
the 25-year-old scored 30 goals in 114 games for the championship side and is david moyes ' second hammers signing .
a transfer request from hugill was turned down by the club in august while neil had previously said north end had no interest in selling him this month .
`` it 's done and we just need to focus on the games we 've got remaining , '' neil told bbc radio lancashire .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: driver admits causing woman 's death
text: a man has admitted causing the death of a woman who was hit by a car in lancashire .
susan shaw , 47 , was struck on high street in rishton on 26 december and died at the scene .
damien raeburn , 31 , from accrington , pleaded guilty at burnley crown court to causing death by dangerous driving .
he also pleaded guilty to driving without a licence and driving without insurance .
he will be sentenced later this month .

documents.title: tim peake 's capsule to go on display in manchester
text: the spacecraft that carried british astronaut tim peake to and from the international space station is to go on display in manchester .
on 15 december 2015 , mjr peake embarked on the principia mission to the international space station and spent six months orbiting earth .
he returned in the soyuz tma-19m on 18 june 2016 , landing in kazakhstan .
the capsule will go on display at manchester 's museum of science and industry from 10 march .
we know our visitors have followed tim peake 's adventures closely , and this will be a fantastic opportunity for them to see first-hand the capsule that was part of his important mission .
manchester is the home of industry and innovation , and what could be a greater symbol of that than this important piece of the history of space travel ?

documents.title: manchester pole dancing class where mums can take their babies
text: a fitness class in manchester is teaching new mums how to pole dance and do aerial hoops - and their babies can come along too .
the babies can sit and play on the floor while watching their mums .
but should mums be pole dancing in front of their young kids ?
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: second man charged over darwen bar murder
text: a second man has been charged in connection with the murder of a 23-year-old who was stabbed in the neck at a darwen bar .
jay jay livesey taylor was attacked at esco-bar in the early hours of sunday and found unconscious outside .
he was taken to royal preston hospital but later died .
jack costello , 44 , of victoria street , in rishton , was charged by detectives with murder and appeared at blackburn magistrates ' court yesterday .
a 30-year-old man from clitheroe has now been charged with assault occasioning actual bodily harm .
he appeared at blackburn magistrates ' court earlier and is due to appear at preston crown court tomorrow .

documents.title: gallery denies censoring victorian nude
text: a gallery has temporarily removed a victorian painting of naked adolescent girls in a move to `` encourage debate '' about how such images should be displayed in the modern age .
manchester art gallery has taken down hylas and the nymphs by jw waterhouse .
curator clare gannaway said there were `` tricky issues about gender , race and representation '' in the gallery .
`` but we want to talk about that with people . ''
she denied accusations that the gallery was censoring the 1896
the decision has already sparked a heated reaction , however , with many on social media accusing the gallery of being puritanical and too politically correct .

documents.title: north west air ambulance adds car to fleet
text: the north west air ambulance has added the first car to its fleet .
the £ 65,000 vehicle has been kitted out for medical use and will be used by paramedics when weather or low light prevents helicopters from flying .
the charity is now looking to raise funds to purchase additional units , which it said would give its patients the best possible chance at survival .

documents.title: osborne urges pm to focus on north-south divide
text: the former chancellor , george osborne , has urged the prime minister to focus on poor education attainment in the north to boost british growth .
mr osborne said that the project he launched whilst he was still at the treasury - the northern powerhouse - was still vital for the economy .
concerns arose in 2017 that the project had been sidelined by theresa may .
his comments come as a new report says there is a major education divide between the north and the south .

documents.title: maintenance work to be carried out on 'much-loved ' hall
text: `` essential repairs '' are set to be carried out on burnley 's towneley hall .
the work will include repairs to the roof , replacement windows and timber treatment for the grade i listed building .
the art and exhibition galleries will remain open to the public throughout the work , which is expected to start later this year and take two months to complete .
towneley hall needs a lot of care and attention to protect and preserve it for generations to come .
this work is part of an ongoing maintenance programme to ensure this historic and much-loved building does n't show her age too much .

documents.title: council to look at new ways of dealing with potholes
text: lancashire county council is considering changing the way it fixes potholes .
the cabinet is being asked to agree to a revised policy which will give priority to the most used roads .
the policy includes a new target to fix potholes or other defects which are 6ins ( 15cm ) or greater in depth , and 1ft ( 30cm ) wide , within one working day
this will be considered at a cabinet meeting later today .

documents.title: liverpool mayor 'interviewed under caution ' over fraud probe
text: the mayor of liverpool has been interviewed under caution as part of a fraud inquiry into a council contract .
joe anderson went to a police station in november over an investigation into financial irregularities at lancashire county council , it has emerged .
mr anderson said he had met police `` voluntarily '' under caution , amid growing calls for him to `` step aside '' .
four men , including liverpool 's chief executive , have been arrested and bailed pending further inquires .

documents.title: manchester comedian bases show around endometriosis
text: manchester comedian amy vreeke has based a show around her diagnosis of endometriosis , in a bid to challenge the taboos around the condition .
the 26-year-old was only diagnosed after years of being wrongly told she had everything from ibs to an sti , and much more in-between .
she only realised what she had after reading lena dunham 's autobiography , in which the girls writer described her own symptoms and struggles with endometriosis .

documents.title: eleven arrests after dawn drugs raids across greater manchester
text: eleven people were arrested as part of dawn raids across greater manchester and lancashire this morning .
the operation , which focused on tackling organised crime , took place in cheetham hill , crumpsall , salford and bacup .
the eleven were arrested on sus of supplying class a drugs and remain in custody .

documents.title: alfie evans : judge to decide sick boy 's treatment
text: the parents of a seriously ill 20-month-old boy with a mystery condition will be in court today in a row over life-support treatment .
tom evans and kate james , from liverpool , want to take their son alfie abroad for treatment .
but doctors in the uk say continuing life-support treatment is not in the child 's best interests .
he was born in a `` semi-vegetative state '' and has a degenerative neurological condition that has not been precisely diagnosed .

firefighters are working to extinguish the small pockets of fire that remain .
they have said the structure of the building is unstable and will be inspected today .
three fire engines are currently at the site of yesterday 's industrial unit fire on bournes row in brindle , damping down & extinguishing small pockets of fire that remain .

documents.title: strangers rally after funeral cash for charity stolen
text: a woman who was burgled of the charity money raised at her mother 's funeral has hailed the `` kindness '' of strangers who replaced it .
denise evans collected about £ 600 for manchester 's st ann 's hos at carol evans ' funeral but it was stolen from her flat in eccles .
friends promoted an online justgiving appeal on twitter and in three days it had raised £ 1,800 .
ms evans , 34 , said : `` it 's all in the spirit of how mum lived life . ''

text: campaigners are urging manchester united to increase the pay of some of its staff because of the `` grotesque '' difference with players ' salaries .
thecitizens ukcharity will pass an open letter to the club in support of match day workers , some of whom it says are paid £ 7 per hour .
the charity 's letter calls on the club to show `` moral leadership '' .
the club said it paid permanent staff the voluntary living wage , more than the statutory national figure .

documents.title: football : wigan athletic and wales midfielder signs contract extension
text: wigan athletic midfielder shaun macdonald has agreed a contract extension until the summer of 2019 .
the 29-year-old , who has been out since april after breaking his leg , made 41 appearances for the latics last season , having joined from bournemouth in the summer of 2016 .
macdonald helped the cherries to promotion to the premier league in 2015 and has won four caps for wales .
he is expected to return to full fitness next month .

no-one was injured in the fire and nearby residents and businesses were advised to close windows and doors .
a booths spokeswoman said none of the chain 's stores were affected .

documents.title: 'tsunami of issues ' at failing school
text: a `` chaotic '' secondary school in wirral has been rated `` inadequate '' by inspectors who found a daily `` tsunami of issues '' .
emslie morgan academy in wallasey takes students excluded from other schools but half were `` persistently absent '' , ofsted inspectors found .
smoking was `` routine '' among students with younger pupils accompanied to the edge of the school grounds to light up .
liverpool city region academy trust said it was `` disappointed '' by the report and aimed to `` raise standards '' .

documents.title: murder arrest after body found in stream
text: a man has been arrested on sus of murder after a body was found in a stream .
the body of gary roscoe was found off deansgreave road in bacup on tuesday .
the 32-year-old arrested man remains in police custody .
police are appealing for information .

he was taken to hospital but later died .

documents.title: manchester workplace parking levy considered
text: a workplace parking levy is one of a number of `` solutions '' being considered to reduce air pollution in manchester .
the levy which in another area will see firms charged more than £ 400 a year was included in draft proposals but manchester is yet to decide who will pay .
the government has asked councils to produce draft plans to improve air quality by march .
backing the idea of a levy , campaign for better transport ( cfbt ) said it would help tackle a `` pollution crisis '' .

documents.title: university 's expansion plan revealed
text: a university has revealed plans to expand so it can increase student numbers from hundreds to thousands .
the university of central lancashire , which currently works with 400 students in the burnley , plans to increase that number to 4,000 by 2025 .
they will be taught at its existing burnley campus , burnley general hospital and victoria mill , the former university technical college lancashire site .
the local council said it meant burnley would `` truly become a university town '' .

documents.title: m & s store closure plan 'disappointing but not surprising '
text: marks and spencer 's ( m & s ) plan to close up to 14 stores including one in stockport has been described as `` disappointing but not surprising '' by the local council .
six shops will shut by april with the closure of another eight including stockport proposed , which will affect hundreds of staff .
it follows a disappointing christmas period for m & s , when sales of both food and clothing fell .
stockport council said it was `` in discussions with the retailer '' and wanted to ensure it can offer affected staff `` as much support as possible . ''

whilst we want to keep marks & spencer in stockport , we are not surprised by the news we will therefore be looking closely at the opportunities our regeneration plans offer them for the future , as well as to support their staff many of whom will be local residents .

documents.title: cooking fires prompt safety campaign
text: about half of accidental fires in homes have started in kitchens , firefighters have said launching a campaign about the dangers .
lancashire fire and rescue service has launched cook safe 2018 after 454 fires in 2017 related to food being cooked in the kitchen .
it said cooking fires occurred in four main areas - blackpool , preston , lancaster and blackburn - with distractions being one of the main causes .
fire safety teams will be offering advice to residents during the campaign which is part of a wider project running across the county .

documents.title: ten years since ferry hit by freak wave
text: a roll-on roll-off ferry carrying 19 crew and four passengers ran aground off the lancashire coast following high winds in the irish sea 10 years ago .
the riverdance ferry was hit by a freak wave during its journey from northern ireland to heysham .
it ran aground in anchorsholme near cleveleys and all 23 people were rescued .
in the aftermath the wreckage became a tourist attraction and businesses in the area experienced the `` best winter season '' they had ever .
carousel licensed diner in cleveleys houses a replica of the vessel and the owner martin hunns said people still travel to have a look at it 10 years on .

documents.title: football : italy and argentina to play a friendly match at city 's etihad stadium
text: italy and argentina will play a friendly match at manchester city 's etihad stadium on friday , 23 march .
the 19:45 gmt kick-off will come four days before england play italy in a friendly match at wembley .
italy failed to qualify for the world cup for the first time since 1958 when they were beaten by sweden in a play-off in november .
argentina qualified for the tournament in russia and will play croatia , nigeria and iceland in the group stage .

documents.title: roads around supermarket warehouse fire site remain open
text: roads remain open around the site of a booths supermarket warehouse fire , which has gutted the building .
about 50 firefighters have been tackling the blaze at brindle mill in bournes row , which broke out just before 10:00 .
all staff were evacuated from the site which is a maintenance and repair centre for equipment used by the supermarket chain .
lancashire road police said there are no road closures are in place `` as the fire is contained on the industrial park '' .

documents.title: fire guts supermarket warehouse
text: a fire has gutted a booths supermarket warehouse after the blaze spread from the first floor to the roof .
about 50 firefighters have been tackling the blaze at brindle mill in bournes row near chorley which broke out just before 10:00 .
all staff were evacuated from the site which is a maintenance and repair centre for equipment used by the supermarket chain .
nearby residents and businesses are being advised to keep windows and doors closed .
a spokeswoman for booths said : `` brindle mill is the works department of booths and service and supply to booths stores are unaffected by this incident . ''
the fire service has asked network rail to slow down trains between blackburn and preston as the tracks are near to the site .

documents.title: six puppies with 'lice and worms ' dumped near canal
text: six puppies dumped near a canal were found in an `` awful state '' with a lice infestation and worms , the rspca has said appealing for information .
the dogs , thought to be german shepherd cross lurchers , were found at a car compound in harwood road , rishton , on 23 january .
rspca inspector nina small said they were found huddled together on the back seat of a car , where the owner of the compound had kept them until she arrived .
they were taken to an rspca centre where they are doing well .
anyone with information is asked to call the animal welfare charity .

documents.title: teenager found dead in speke garden was stabbed
text: a teenager whose body was found in a garden in liverpool died from stab wounds , a post-mortem examination has confirmed .
the body of 17-year-old brandon regan was found at a property in critchley road , speke , at about 10:20 on monday .
two men aged 31 and 32 from speke who were arrested on sus of murder have been bailed .
merseyside police said they were keeping an `` open mind '' as to the motive and have appealed for information .

documents.title: m & s plans to close up to 14 stores
text: marks and spencer is planning to close 14 stores with hundreds of jobs affected .
stores in birkenhead , bournemouth , durham , fforestfach , putney and redditch will close by april .
staff have been offered jobs in nearby stores .
the closure of another eight stores including stockport has been proposed , which will affect 468 staff .
it follows a disappointing christmas period for m & s , when sales of clothing and food fell .

documents.title: future of accrington walk-in centre uncertain
text: the future of accrington victoria 's walk-in centre is looking uncertain again as east lancashire 's clinical commissioning group announced they were scrapping its contract at the end of march .
the centre , on haywood road , serves people across the east of the county and was given a fifth reprieve last september .
nearly 10,000 people have signed an online petition for the centre to be saved .
the ccg says they will keep the public updated throughout the process .

documents.title: flood alerts in place across the region
text: people have been urged to take care after flood alerts were issued across the north west .
there are alerts at morecambe bay , the mersey and wyre estuaries .
the tide is forecast to peak between 09:00 and 13:00 .
further information from the environment agency can be found here .

documents.title: cheshire east council : 200 staff say they were bullied in second half of 2017
text: the behaviour of `` some individuals with power '' has led to council staff in cheshire being bullied , an independent report found .
some 14 % of respondents to a survey - about 200 cheshire east council employees - said they had experienced it during the second half of 2017 .
some felt former council leader michael jones may have `` set a tone '' which `` encouraged '' or `` excused '' unacceptable behaviour , the report added .
but mr jones told the bbc the problem got worse after he stood down in 2015 .

documents.title: 'mahrez would be a short-term fix for man city '
text: manchester city 's interest in riyad mahrez has been formed as a result of the injuries to leroy sane and gabriel jesus , according to the mirror 's chief football writer , john cross .
city launched their move for mahrez on the same day it was revealed that sane would miss up to seven weeks of football with an ankle injury sustained against cardiff city .
gabriel jesus has also been out injured since city 's draw against crystal palace , leaving city with just three senior forwards available .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: man charged with murder over darwen bar stabbing
text: a man has been charged with murder over the fatal stabbing of a 23-year-old man at a bar in darwen at the weekend .
jay jay livesey taylor was stabbed in the neck in esco-bar on borough road at about 01:20 gmt on sunday .
mr livesey taylor , who was from the town , was taken to royal preston hospital for treatment but later died .
jack costello , 35 , of victoria street , rishton has been charged with murder and is due before magistrates later .
two men from darwen , aged 30 and 32 , who were arrested over the attack have been bailed .

documents.title: manchester theatre wins national award
text: manchester 's hope mill theatre has been named fringe theatre of the year in the stage 's annual awards .
the accolade , announced on friday , is the latest for the theatre which opened two years ago .
the 120-seat venue , founded by joseph houston and william whelton , was nominated in the same category at last year 's awards
the theatre 's productions include hair the musical and yank ! , both of which later transferred to london .

documents.title: body of teenager found in garden
text: the body of a teenager has been found in a garden in liverpool , prompting a murder investigation .
the remains of brandon regan , 17 , were found at a property on critchley road , speke , at about 10:20 gmt on monday .
merseyside police said a post-mortem examination to determine the cause of his death was due to take place .
two men , who are aged 31 and 32 and both from speke , have been arrested on sus of murder and remain in police custody for questioning .

documents.title: grade ii listed burnley theatre receives boost
text: the prospect of saving a threatened theatre building in burnley has received a boost .
the empire theatre opened in 1894 and in its heyday , acts from all over the world performed there including houdini .
it was last used as a bingo hall in 1995 , and has been in serious decline ever since .
now , the trust formed to save the grade ii listed building has succeeded in taking it from fourth on the theatres at risk register 2018 to 14th .
the theatres trust is calling for local authorities to better support their theatre buildings by developing the opportunities they offer to their communities .

documents.title: boxing : amir khan throws water at phil lo greco in heated exchange
text: bolton 's amir khan threw water over opponent phil lo greco on tuesday - reacting to talk about his personal life .
the pair meet in liverpool on 21 april , when british welterweight khan fights for the first time in nearly two years .
at a pre-fight promotional event , lo greco pointed to khan 's family issues and marital difficulties since losing to saul 'canelo ' alvarez in may 2016 .
and the former world champion , 31 , responded by throwing water at the canadian , prompting an on-stage melee .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: stranger pays for 'humbled ' medic 's fuel
text: an ambulance worker said he was `` blown away '' when a stranger paid his petrol bill as a thank you to people who `` do a fantastic job '' .
emergency medical technician tony jones , of rochdale , said he was `` humbled '' by the random act of kindness on his way to a night shift on sunday .
he tracked down his good samaritan - tony coray - after an appeal on facebook went viral .
mr coray , also from rochdale , said the act was a `` goodwill gesture '' .

documents.title: arena attack 'hero ' jailed for theft
text: a homeless man who stole from victims of the manchester arena bomb attack has been jailed .
chris parker was hailed a hero after saying he helped , but cctv showed him stealing from two victims and taking photos of others as they lay dying .
the 33-year-old had previously admitted stealing a purse and a mobile phone .
jailing him for four years and three months at manchester crown court , judge david hernandez told parker : `` you were not the hero you pretended to be . ''

documents.title: about 400 mourners bid farewell to tommy lawrence
text: about 400 people came to pay their respects to liverpool legend tommy lawrence in warrington today .
several liverpool scarves could be seen among mourners gathered in the churchyard , many recounting memories of the scottish keeper from the shankly era who won three caps for his country .
during the service , three of the goalkeeper 's ten grandchildren gave memories of him as a family man .
ryan murray said his grandad loved the unflattering nickname 'the flying pig ' .
he said lfc was his grandfather 's life and he treated fans as family .
he was the embodiment of what a footballer should be and if there were more like him , football would be a better place . ''

documents.title: arena attack 'hero ' sold photos of dead and dying
text: a homeless man jailed for stealing from victims of the manchester bomb attack took photos of the dead and dying which he later sold for £ 100 .
chris parker was jailed for four years and three months at manchester crown court after cctv footage showed him rummaging through possessions of victims and survivors of the may 22 suicide bombing .
the 33-year-old had previously admitted stealing a mobile phone belonging to a seriously injured teenager who had been holding the handset as the bomb went off .
the phone rang a number of times as people were trying to contact her .
parker terminated one call with an automatic return text message which read : `` sorry i ca n't talk right now . ''
the footage also showed him taking photographs of the victims .
prosecutor louise brandon showed the judge four taken in the foyer which , she said , he later sold to a reporter for £ 100 .

documents.title: two held after teen 's body found in speke garden
text: the body of a teenager has been found in a garden in liverpool , prompting a murder investigation .
brandon regan , 17 , was found at a property on critchley road , speke , at about 10:20 gmt on monday .
merseyside police said a post-mortem examination to determine the cause of his death was due to take place .

documents.title: football : manchester city sign french defender for club record £ 57m
text: manchester city have signed french defender aymeric laporte from athletic bilbao for a club record fee of £ 57m .
the fee for laporte , yet to win a cap for france , takes spending by premier league clubs to £ 252m this month - a record for a january transfer window .
and the 23-year-old 's arrival takes city 's spending on defenders since the end of last season to £ 190m .
the club 's previous record fee wasthe £ 55m paid to wolfsburg for belgium midfielder kevin de bruyne in 2015 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: claire house opens second hos in liverpool
text: wirral children 's hos claire house is to open a new site in liverpool today .
it has taken over the former carmelite monastery on honey 's green lane in west derby which had previously been occupied for over 100 years by a closed order of nuns .
claire house helps seriously and terminally ill children by providing specialist nursing care and emotional support .
work is continuing to develop the liverpool site but it can already offer day-care services , counselling and complementary therapies .

text: latest headlines for the north west

documents.title: tommy lawrence was 'the best 1v1 goalkeeper ' around - ray clemence
text: former england number one ray clemence said he learned so much '' from tommy lawrence who was the first sweeper-keeper '' .
attending his funeral in warrington , clemence , who replaced tommy as liverpool 's keeper said : for me at the time he was probably the best 1v1 goalkeeper around '' .
i think he deserved to play for scotland more than he did - of course you ca n't play for liverpool for the number of years he did unless you 're a very , very good goalkeeper . ''
phil thompson , who was centre-back at liverpool between 1971 and 1984 and met tommy after joining as an apprentice , said he was an absolute legend and his laugh was quite infectious '' .
you can imagine being a fan and you 've come from the kop and cleaning boots for me to bridge that gap and become a friend it was great .
all those lads of that era , i think it was just an extra special time for liverpool fans '' .

documents.title: phone shop manager jailed for stealing phones
text: the manager of a mobile phone company has been jailed after stealing thousands of pounds worth of stock .
michael doyle , 44 , of parkgate drive , leyland , used a computer system to steal 345 phones between january and july 2017 , worth £ 185,000 , from carphone warehouse in blackburn .
following an internal investigation , the losses were reported to police and he was arrested .
doyle was charged with theft and pleaded guilty at preston crown court on 26 january .
he was sentenced to two years .
