documents.title: arena attack thief parker banned from manchester city centre
text: chris parker was jailed for theft of a purse and a mobile phone , fraudulently using a bank card that was in the stolen purse , and breaching his bail conditions .
the judge told him he would serve half his sentence in custody before being released on licence .
parker was also banned from manchester city centre for 10 years .

documents.title: roger hunt pays respects to 'brilliant sweeper-keeper '
text: roger hunt remembered former teammate tommy lawrence as a brilliant sweeper-keeper '' .
we were very friendly , a long time ago until now '' , he said inside the church before the service .

widely known to liverpool fans as sir '' roger , he recalled scoring a few past him over the years '' and said that tommy 's nickname 'the flying pig ' , though it sounded critical , was affectionate '' .

documents.title: red lfc banner covers tommy lawrence coffin
text: a red lfc drape covered tommy lawrence 's coffin as the hearse arrived for the liverpool legend 's funeral in warrington .
club anthem you 'll never walk alone played and mourners clapped as the coffin was placed back in the hearse following the service at st elphin 's church which was led by rev stewart mctaggart .

documents.title: crowds gather for liverpool legend 's funeral
text: mourners have filled st elphin 's parish church in warrington for the funeral of former liverpool goalkeeper tommy lawrence .
robbie fowler and kenny dalglish have joined former teammates in remembering bill shankly 's first-choice keeper during the 1960s .

documents.title: you are not a hero , but a common thief ' - judge tells chris parker
text: cctv footage shown to manchester crown court showed 33-year-old chris parker wandering the foyer of the arena stealing from victims .
at one point he stole a purse belonging to injured survivor pauline healey , whose granddaughter lay dying nearby , using her bank card at a fast food restaurant .
parker claimed to have helped some of those injured in the attack and was initially hailed a hero , with more than £ 50,000 being raised by the public to help him .
last month , he admitted to stealing a purse and a mobile phone from two victims .
sentencing him to four years and three months , judge david hernandez said : you represented yourself as a hero .
`` sadly you were not the hero you pretended to be - you were just a common thief . ''

documents.title: breakinghomeless man jailed for stealing from arena attack victims
text: a homeless man who stole from victims of the manchester bomb attack has been jailed for more than four years .
chris parker , 33 , was initially hailed a hero after claiming he comforted a seriously injured girl , manchester crown court was told .
more details to follow

documents.title: mourners arrive for funeral of tommy lawrence
text: family , friends and fans are arriving at warrington parish church for the funeral of former liverpool goalkeeper tommy lawrence , who died aged 77 .
former teammates including ian st john , ray clemence , roger hunt and ian callaghan are there to pay their respects to the scotsman .

documents.title: manchester one of the 'fastest growing cities in europe '
text: manchester is now one of the fastest growing cities in europe due to the increasing amount of construction , according to a survey .
accountants deloitte released their annual survey of cranes on the skyline of manchester and salford .
more than 11,000 flats are being built across the two city centres .
salford 's deputy mayor john merry says that , after years of population decline , thousands of people are moving back .

documents.title: 'arrogant ' magazine fraudster jailed for £ 2m scam
text: a businessman who cheated thousands of small firms out of £ 2m by selling adverts for fake magazines promoting the emergency services has been jailed .
peter daly , 38 , of hilton grove , west kirby , initially denied fraud but admitted the offence halfway through the trial .
he operated from different premises , including market street in birkenhead , and used virtual office services in london to hide his location , the court was told .
on monday , he was jailed for eight years and a month at liverpool crown court , with judge andrew menary qc describing daly as `` cocky , arrogant , and egotistical '' .

documents.title: joe bloggs owner and fashion firm east go into administration
text: the owner of joe bloggs , the fashion label that became synonymous with the `` madchester '' music scene of the late 1980s , has gone into administration .
juice corporation has made 60 people redundant and its assets are being put up for sale .
in the 1980s joe bloggs ' signature baggy denim jeans were worn by the likes of manchester bands happy mondays and inspiral carpets .
the brand was set up by shami ahmed in 1985 , riding the wave of manchester 's cultural and musical resurgence in the late 1980s and making mr ahmed a multi-millionaire .
asian-inspired high street fashion brand east has also gone into administration .

documents.title: lancaster 's greyhound bridge closed for six months
text: people travelling in and around lancaster are being reminded that the greyhound bridge , which carries the a683 ( greyhound bridge road ) over the river lune , is closed .
repair work costing £ 3.7m is being funded by a government grant and is part of a scheme to improve highways across the uk .
the work is expected to finish in six months , and lancashire county council says it will ensure hgvs and heavy lorries can use the bridge in the future .
traffic is being diverted and motorists are being encouraged to use skerton bridge and the bay gateway .

documents.title: ex-manchester united players ' university plans approved
text: members of manchester united 's `` class of '92 '' have had their plans to build a university and 20-storey student village approved .
the university academy '92 ( ua92 ) is part of a £ 170m trafford council plan for the greater manchester area .
the original designs were modified after locals said the proposed `` ugly tower block '' was an `` eyesore '' .
trafford council 's executive committee endorsed the proposals in a vote on monday .

documents.title: funeral of tommy lawrence to be held
text: legendary liverpool goalkeeper tommy lawrence 's funeral will be held in warrington later .
the scotsman , who won three caps for his country , was bill shankly 's first-choice keeper at anfield during the 1960s .
he died earlier this month aged 77 .
the funeral service will take place at st elphin 's church at 12:30 .
supporters have been told they are welcome to attend .

documents.title: liverpool fan : 'ben foster is a great goalkeeper '
text: a liverpool fan has criticised simon mignolet 's role in liverpool 's fa cup fourth round defeat by west bromwich albion on saturday .
mark told bbc radio 5 live that if the reds had have had west brom 's ben foster in goal , they 'd have progressed to the last 16 rather than losing 3-2 .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: bullying and harassment 'does take place ' at council
text: a report out today says there is evidence of bullying and harrassment at cheshire east council .
a review of the authority 's culture says while bullying affects only a minority of employees , `` it is having a profound effect on those who experience or witness it '' .
the report was written by the local government association which was asked by the council to carry out an independent review .
the council 's acting chief executive kath o'dwyer said the authority was `` determined to take all necessary action '' to address concerns raised .
author: Jack Dowling
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: woman raped after leaving city-centre bar
text: a woman was raped whilst walking through manchester city centre in the early hours of sunday morning , police said .
after leaving a bar in the printworks at about 03:00 gmt , she headed to nearby exchange square .
the woman , who is in her 20s , told police she then heard someone shout over to her : `` where you at ? ''
two men , described as white , in their 30s and speaking with local accents , then allegedly assaulted her .

documents.title: football : 'i 'm not a sexist ' - england women 's boss phil neville
text: phil neville has denied he is sexist and said he has huge respect for women in his first media appearance after being appointed england women 's head coach .
last week the former manchester united and everton full-back apologised a day into the job or past tweets about women .
`` i had to apologise , i did n't like the words used , '' neville said .
`` i 'm not a sexist .
i 've lived my life right . ''
the appointment has been criticised because of neville 's lack of coaching and women 's football experience but he denied the job was a `` stepping stone '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: scouse gogglebox star 'not returning ' to show
text: gogglebox star june bernicoff has hinted she will not be returning to the hit channel 4 show following the death of her husband leon .
a fan posted a message on twitter asking june , from liverpool , whether she would do the show with one of her daughters .
june replied : `` it was a great adventure with a great finale with the nta , '' referring to the show 's recent best factual entertainment award .
fan favourite leon died in december at the age of 83 .

documents.title: body found in garden at speke
text: a man 's body has been found in the garden of a house in liverpool .
merseyside police said the force is treating the death as `` unexplained '' following the body 's discovery at about 10:20 gmt in critchley road , speke .
`` the male has not yet been formally identified and work is ongoing to trace his next of kin , '' said a merseyside police spokesman .

documents.title: man wanted over assault at padiham house party
text: police want to speak to a man after a 28-year-old from colne was attacked and left with a fractured jaw at a house party .
the attack happened in the early hours of 1 january when the man was punched at the party at a property on hargrove avenue .
police want to speak to 22-year-old jesse rivers from blackburn .
he is described as white , about 5ft 9ins and of medium build with light brown hair .
anyone with information is asked to contact police .

documents.title: jimmy armfield funeral date confirmed
text: the funeral of former england football captain jimmy armfield will take place in blackpool on 8 february .
armfield , who was capped 43 times by england and made a club record 627 appearances for the seasiders , died from cancer aged 82 last week .
a private funeral service is planned but the cortege will pass through blackpool 's bloomfield road ground for fans to pay their respects .
a memorial service to celebrate his life will be held at a later date .

documents.title: man charged over alleged sexual abuse at children 's homes
text: a runcorn man has been charged with a number of sexual offences following a police investigation into alleged abuse at two children 's homes .
officers have been investigating allegations relating to the former kilrie children 's home in knutsford and taxel edge children 's home , near buxton in derbyshire .
cheshire police said the claims relate to eight victims and were said to have taken place between october 1975 and june 1978 , and between august 1980 and march 1981 .
bruce mcclean , 61 , is due to face 40 charges at stockport magistrates ' court on 26 february .

documents.title: amir khan to fight first bout since 2016
text: bolton 's amir khan will fight canadian phil lo greco at the liverpool echo arena on 21 april in his first bout for almost two years .
khan , 31 , was beaten by saul alvarez in a wbc middleweight title bout in may 2016 , his most recent fight .
`` he will be coming with everything to win this fight and i 'm not going to give him an inch , '' said former light-welterweight world champion khan .
`` he 's an aggressive fighter who is always looking to come forward . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fa cup : wigan take plaudits , while liverpool fall foul of var
text: it was a great fa cup fourth round weekend for four out of the six north west teams in action , with wigan pulling off one of the results of the round - a comfortable 2-0 victory over the premier league 's west ham united .
elsewhere , manchester united and manchester city both breezed past lower league opposition and league one strugglers rochdale came within a whisker of knocking out championship side millwall .
for liverpool and preston north end though , it was a weekend to forget - particularly for the reds , who lost out in a game dominated by video assistant referee decisions .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: inside out investigation reveals fraudulent tradespeople
text: a man from merseyside has been speaking about losing a huge sum of money after a tradesman he found on a website turned out to be a fraud .
a bbc inside out investigation revealed that fraudulent tradespeople could advertise their services on two trusted trade websites - rated people and mybuilder - without any experience .
david ball , from prescot , handed over £ 1,500 to a tradesman he found on rated people to repair damp , but he failed to treat the problem and is now `` nowhere to be seen '' .
mr ball said he had used the site `` because you think there 's a level of protection there you 're not getting if you 're going direct . ''
rated people said tradespeople looking to sign up were screened with a credit agency , fraud prevention agencies and it `` regularly reassesses all members '' .

documents.title: date set for jimmy armfield funeral
text: the funeral of former england and blackpool captain jimmy armfield is to be held next week in blackpool , his family have said .
armfield , who made a club record 627 appearances for the tangerines , died of cancer aged 82 last week .
his funeral service - which is restricted to family and close friends - is to be held on thursday 8 february at st peter 's church on lytham road at 12:30 followed by a private committal .
for those wishing to pay their respects , a funeral cortege will pass through blackpool football ground at 12:00 where the service will be broadcast on loudspeakers .

documents.title: woman raped in manchester city centre
text: a woman was raped while walking through manchester city centre in the early hours of sunday , police have said .
greater manchester police said the woman , in her 20s , was heading towards exchange square after leaving the printworks at about 03:00 , when she heard someone shout : `` where you at ? ''
she was approached by two men , and was then raped .
highlighting the `` severity '' of the attack , det sgt nicole charlton said the woman had been `` courageous '' in reporting what happened and officers were working to get her `` answers '' .
anyone with information about what happened is asked to contact police .

documents.title: passengers face longer journeys from hull to manchester
text: people travelling from hull to manchester by train will face slower journeys from may .
five smaller stations have been transferred from the northern franchise to the transpennine franchise , meaning the trains will have to stop at extra stations on the route to manchester .
the move has been criticised by the hull north mp diana johnson , who says the city deserves a better deal .
we 've been told for many years that the idea is to speed up journeys across the north , so this is very disappointing .
we need proper investment and funding in this part of the world . ''

documents.title: blackburn among towns 'most likely to lose out to robots '
text: blackburn is one a number of towns and cities across the uk which are `` most at risk of losing jobs to robots '' , a report claims .
the centre for cities estimates that by 2030 nine areas could lose more than a quarter of jobs to automation and artificial intelligence .
roles in shops , administration and warehouses are the most at risk .
the government has said it is committed to helping people secure `` the jobs of tomorrow '' with a national retraining scheme .

documents.title: workers at birkenhead shipyard stage second strike
text: hundreds of workers at birkenhead 's cammell laird shipyard are on strike again today .
they held their first walkout on friday , because of a dispute over pay and conditions .
the gmb union claims their members have been `` backed into a corner by management . ''
the firm 's chief executive has described their demands as unrealistic and unaffordable .

documents.title: anti-terror group to aims 'to defeat terrorism at its source '
text: survivors of uk terrorist attacks and bereaved relatives have launched a group to lobby the government over its anti-terror policies .
survivors against terror wants more effective measures against terrorism and greater support for its victims .
founders include the husband of murdered west yorkshire mp jo cox and dan hett , whose brother martyn was killed in the manchester arena bombing .
brendan cox said the group would try `` to defeat terrorism at its source '' .

documents.title: trains between preston and blackpool south resume
text: rail services between preston and blackpool south have resumed today , following work to complete the first phase of an upgrade between the towns .
the line closed last november as part of the electrification upgrade between preston and the resort .
the first train from preston arrived at the station this morning .
the blackpool north line remains closed and buses will continue to replace train services until 25 march , as engineering work continues .
this time with a working video the first train arriving into # blackpoolsouth this morning # gnrp @ northernassist @ twitterid

documents.title: football : manchester city target set to complete move
text: athletic bilbao defender aymeric laporte is set to travel to england on monday to complete his club record move to manchester city .
it is anticipated the blues will trigger laporte 's £ 57m release clause , allowing him to have his medical and complete his transfer .
city manager pep guardiola was keen to bring in a new centre-half this month .
the club 's current transfer record is the £ 55m paid for midfielder kevin de bruyne in 2015 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: grammys pay tribute to victims of manchester arena attack
text: one of the pivotal moments at the grammys last night was a tribute to the music-loving victims of the tragedies in manchester and las vegas .
handwritten notes bearing the names of the dead were projected on the stage as country music stars maren morris , eric church and brothers osborne performed eric clapton 's tears in heaven .
all three acts played at the route 91 festival in las vegas last october before a gunman opened fire on the audience , killing 58 .
twenty-two people died five months earlier in a suicide bomb attack outside an ariana grande concert at manchester arena .

documents.title: 'potentially dangerous ' suspect named in darwen bar murder inquiry
text: police investigating the murder of a man in an `` unprovoked '' attack at a bar have named a suspect they want to speak to .
the victim , aged 23 , was at esco-bar in darwen , lancashire , when he was stabbed in the neck early on sunday .
lancashire police want to trace jack costello , 45 , but have warned the public not to approach him .
det supt simon giles said : `` he is a potentially dangerous and violent individual .
if you see him , contact police immediately . ''

documents.title: football : 'protect players ' call after leroy sane injury at cardiff
text: manchester city boss pep guardiola urged referees to protect players after leroy sane was injured during the fa cup win at cardiff city .
guardiola 's side eased to a 2-0 win over the championship club to reach the fifth round as kevin de bruyne and raheem sterling struck .
but guardiola confirmed sane could miss up to a month after joe bennett 's foul .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: anthony grainger shooting : officers face 'gross misconduct ' probe
text: two senior manchester police officers are being investigated for alleged gross misconduct over evidence given to an inquiry into the fatal shooting of an unarmed man , the bbc has learned .
assistant chief constable steve heywood , who authorised the operation in which anthony grainger died , and det ch insp robert cousen have been or will be interviewed under caution .
the independent office for police conduct ( iopc ) is behind the probe .
mr grainger died in cheshire in 2012 .
